title: Riot at its finest
body: I am an honors level 5 player for the last 4 years now. I was just in a game when several people were calling me %%%% and making personal attacks about my weight based on a game. I was shocked to find out that I had been banned as a result. It seems as though riot does not investigate games but instead looks at the number of reports, as 2 of the people I reported for VERBAL abuse were in a party of 3. Is this the community that Riot games wants? I did not want to believe the things I have read about the toxic environment of riot as a company and yet here I am seeing that they have no respect for women or the demeaning insults that are thrown around in that game. I challenge any riot employee to review the game chat and show me why I deserved a ban when I was the subject of the abuse. I urge anyone who has been subject to this to add me and share your story. This company survives off of the players, is this the kind of environment we want from the company that we fund an support on a daily basis?! Lets see how long this post stays up, anyone can add me on FB, Vek Fi and I will be sure to spread the word any ways I can. This is not right and it will not stand.

replies.body:
1) Honor level 5 has existed for less than two years.

2) Number of reports have been confirmed multiple times to not matter.

3) Rather than challenging a Riot employee, simply post your chat logs here and we can tell you exactly what the issue was.

So for me not everything is exactly clear, but:

If you didn't have a previous 25game chat restriction (and now you got 14day banned), then you should submit a support ticket, since the ZT words you used are not dorected at the enemy. They will probably reduce it to a chat restrict, since they can always find something to call toxic.

If you had a 25 game chat restriction beforehand, then a 14 ban can be reasonable (or at least how Rito works).
If you had a 14 day bad before, then your account is probably gone,

Anyway submit a support ticket and explain that the ZT word was not directed at anybody, that's your best chance.
Making a Thread in every board isn't going to help your case.

> I am an honors level 5 player for the last 4 years now

Honor level 5 has been in league for only 2 years...

> I was just in a game when several people were calling me %%%% and making personal attacks about my weight based on a game. I was shocked to find out that I had been banned as a result.

You said something back to them that you should've not. And don't call it ''defending  yourself''. Counterflaming isn't justifiable.

>  It seems as though riot does not investigate games but instead looks at the number of reports, as 2 of the people I reported for VERBAL abuse were in a party of 3.

Number of reports is irrelevant, since even 1 report triggers an investigation. The chat bot looks at the chat logs and finds toxic act from there, which I presume you used as well. 

Looking at your logs, you were harassing your team, and also using sexist language so I'm not surprised you got punished.

You don't get banned if you don't do anything wrong. Even if the entire enemy team were trolls trying to mass report you to get you banned for the fun of it, those reports won't go anywhere if there isn't anything to back it up with. At the end of the day, it's you that's responsible for your own conduct, not them. If they're really getting to you (and I know what that feels like), just type '/mute all' into the chat box and report them for misconduct after the game. 

I hope that helps you out in the future!

You're offended by the their comments on your weight (how would they know) but in return you suggest that the offending players are unhappy about the size of their reproductive organs (how would YOU know)...?

If someone is obese, or has a micropenis, or asymmetric breasts, or hyperhydrosis, or male pattern baldness, or ovarian cysts, or whatever -  I say OWN IT and let the trollers and flamers be damned. (and report 'em too!)

And don't flame them back - those idiots aren't worth your account.
